title: National Amateur Cup (Malta)
text:
The National Amateur Cup is an annual <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">knockout</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition that takes place in <a href="Malta">Malta</a>.
The tournament is open to all the teams that take part in the <a href="Maltese%20National%20Amateur%20League">National Amateur League</a>, the third and last level of <a href="Football%20in%20Malta">Maltese football</a> and some teams from the <a href="Gozo%20Football%20League">Gozo Football League</a>.
The teams that reach the semi-final stage are allowed to take part in the <a href="Maltese%20FA%20Trophy">Maltese FA Trophy</a> preliminary round.
Format.
The tournament was created in 2020, following a general restructuring of the Maltese football system by the <a href="Malta%20Football%20Association">Malta Football Association</a>. It was decided to create a new single-elimination competition reserved for the teams from the lower categories.
The first season of the cup started in October 2020 and it was interrupted and later declared cancelled on 9 April 2021 due to the decision of the MFA to stop all the competitions because of <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Malta">COVID-19 pandemic in Malta</a>. <a href="Munxar%20Falcons%20F.C.">Munxar Falcons</a> and <a href="%C5%BBebbu%C4%A1%20Rovers%20F.C.">Żebbuġ Rovers</a> were the first two <a href="Gozo">Gozitan</a> teams that played in the competition.
